The appointment of Mange 'Dick' Cheney as SU Welfare officer has raised many questions from York University's vocal anti-war lobby.

Somewhere Over The Rainbow

Do dreams come true? Gareth Arnold spends some time with the latest residents to check into the White Swan Hotel, and uncovers their ambitious plans to transform one of the cities biggest eye-sores...

The Confessional

After sucessfully cleansing Ms Khoo's soul, resident man of god, Rev. U. R. Blessed invites another tormented student to his oak booth. Join us in prayer as David White confesses to his scornful ways...

Pride And Prejudice

Pride manifests itself in many forms. Patriotism can be a positive and unifying force. It can also result in violence, prejudice and fear. When this occurs the outcome can be very far away from Austen's tales of love and marriage. Hannah Dehaan finds that she can locate a frightening mass of British-based, fascist political doctrine, with only a few clicks of a mouse button...

Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome

Concentrated in China, a killer virus called SARS spreads fear and death across the globe. As the mass media continues to etch the impression of a post-modern nightmare into our consciousness. Catherine Wood takes a look at the science and statistics, and asks "...are we worrying about nothing?"

The War is Won

In case the last few days' weather was enough to whisk you off to Scarborough for the weekend where you then got trapped under a big rock on the beach and missed everything, we've had some guests here in York for the last few days. They came from a town called Lancaster, which is about 60 miles away, across the Pennines. In the fifteenth century, they'd probably have come to slaughter us, but nowadays they just beat us at darts, pool and golf and let us take the rest. Well more or less, but the Roses weekend is about so much more than that. It's about meeting new people and making new friends, basking in the sunshine during the day and dancing the night away until the next day's kick-off and just having good, clean fun...

Sizzle In The Sun

The sun has got his hat on, as Lizzi Holman shouts hooray and heralds the start of the best thing about summertime, the barbeque season and the joys of eating in the great outdoors.

Cous-cous a la Delia

This was a recipe I first made one day last summer, and since then whip it out at any excuse. Its moved away from Delia Smith's original so as to make up for the fact that I don't always have the ingredients necessary. The important thing is a really sharp dressing, and generous lumps of firm goats cheese.
